intro: Wahlenbergia capensis, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas and thrives in well-drained soil. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Wahlenbergia capensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
